meanings.definition: To score one stroke under par on a hole in golf.
meanings.sent1: She birdied the last hole to win the golf tournament.
meanings.sent2: He birdied three holes in a row and was in the lead.
meanings.sent3: The golfer birdied so many holes, the other players were amazed.
meanings.sent4: Her accuracy with the putter birdied her way to victory.
meanings.sent5: The crowd cheered as he birdied the final hole with a perfect shot.

meanings.definition: Past tense of the verb 'birdie', meaning to achieve a score of one stroke under par on a hole in golf.
meanings.sent1: They birdied the 18th hole to secure their win.
meanings.sent2: After a great shot, she birdied the challenging par 3.
meanings.sent3: The golfer proudly birdied the last hole, celebrating with a dance.
meanings.sent4: His consistent putting birdied him to victory in the tournament.
meanings.sent5: With a precise swing, he birdied the hole and set a new personal record.
